content:
Diagnosis
	1. Squamous cell carcinoma right lower lobe lung with bone and liver metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb 2024 - Palliative radiotherapy to T8 vertebral metastasis (20Gy/5#)

	Chemotherapy
	Carboplatin/Pembrolizumab commenced 01 Feb 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Mixed response - improving bone pain but new liver lesions

	Current issues
	Fatigue, reduced mobility, liver function derangement

	Summary of consultation
	This 64-year-old gentleman was reviewed today in clinic. Recent CT imaging from 15 April 2024 shows mixed response with stable bone metastases but progression in liver with two new lesions in segments 6 and 7 measuring 2.1cm and 1.8cm respectively. His main symptoms are worsening fatigue and right upper quadrant discomfort. His mobility has declined, now requiring a walking frame. Liver function tests show new derangement with ALT 156, ALP 345.

Performance status has declined to ECOG 2. On examination, there is tender hepatomegaly extending 4cm below costal margin. Chest examination reveals reduced air entry at right base but no added sounds.

Given progression on first-line therapy, we have discussed second-line treatment options. In view of FGFR amplification status, we will commence Erdafitinib. I have explained the monitoring requirements including phosphate levels and ophthalmology review.

	Further investigations
	Baseline ophthalmology assessment
Repeat CT in 8 weeks
Weekly phosphate monitoring

	Medication prescribed
	Erdafitinib 8mg daily
Paracetamol 1g QDS
Oxycodone MR 20mg BD

	Follow up
	Weekly review for first month of Erdafitinib
Next oncology follow up in 1 week

	Required GP actions
	Weekly blood tests including phosphate
Please monitor liver function
Referral to community physiotherapy requested

cancer_timeline.value: Palliative radiotherapy to T8 vertebral metastasis (20Gy/5#)
CT shows progression with two new liver lesions in segments 6 and 7 (2.1cm and 1.8cm)
Liver function derangement with ALT 156, ALP 345
Stopping first-line therapy due to disease progression
Commencing Erdafitinib 8mg daily as second-line therapy

patient_facts.value: Tender hepatomegaly extending 4cm below costal margin
Reduced air entry at right base
Requires walking frame due to reduced mobility
Liver function derangement with ALT 156, ALP 345

status_updates.value: Stage IV squamous cell lung cancer with bone and liver metastases. Disease progression on first-line therapy with new liver lesions and declining performance status
Mixed response with stable bone metastases but progression in liver with two new lesions
Switching from first-line Carboplatin/Pembrolizumab to Erdafitinib 8mg daily
Declined to ECOG PS 2 with reduced mobility requiring walking frame
Baseline ophthalmology assessment, repeat CT in 8 weeks, weekly phosphate monitoring
Weekly review for first month of Erdafitinib, next oncology follow up in 1 week
